intro: Synotis lucorum, commonly known as the common white butterfly. It is a species of butterfly belonging to the family Pieridae, characterized by its white wings with black markings. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Its life cycle involves a complex interaction with host plants, primarily those in the Apiaceae family. The plant plays a significant role in supporting local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
